comment: Parasitology was a amazing class.  I will take any class this professor offers.  You should too.

Provides outlines that you print out and fill out during lecture. Must go to lectures, Powerpoints aren't provided online. Tests can be difficult but as long as you study the handouts thoroughly, you should be fine.

Took this professor for parasitology and it was my first experience with one of the new Marietta campus professors.  What a great experience!  Memorable, informative lectures that were often both hilarious and nightmare-inducing.  I am certain I will never forget this class.  Prepare to work though!  Don't skip class or it will end badly for you.

Best professor I've had. I already enjoy parasitology but he made it even better. Took him as an earlier morning class and it was never hard to attend, partially because he is an amazing, engaging lecturer but also because attendance is mandatory.. miss more than 3 classes, you automatically fail. Clear expectations, but be prepared to work hard!

I took Human Anatomy with him In Spring 2015, which was the first semester of the KSUSPSU consolidation. Phenomenal lecturer!  Expect to put some serious work into his classes. You won't regret it though as he is fair and you will learn a ton. I'd take him again in a heartbeat!

Marine Biology was a great class.  The rumors are true.  Sugalski's lectures are engaging, well organized, interesting, and often hilarious.  He is also uncompromising in his standards, so the lazy should steer clear.

Sugalski is arguably the most professional professor. This class is quite difficult, I got a C. Be prepared for crazy life cycles. Even though it was horrendously hard, I reminisce fondly on this class.

Probably should've taken the other guy's class for a better grade but I can't stay anything bad about Dr. Sugalski. He tries to come off as a tough guy, but he's really not. He's really nice. You HAVE to study hard for his class. No exceptions and you can't miss a day. Its the labs that killed me but he's a great teacher and so is his class.

Dr. Sugalski is the best professor I've ever had. Loved his Anatomy and Physiology classes (separate semesters). It is mind-blowing to realize how much material you actually learn once the semester is done. Highly recommended! Very professional atmosphere!

Very dedicated to biology and wants you to be as well. Very nice and funny guy but I can see him being a nightmare if u got on his bad side! Gives plenty of opportunities for extra credit and you will need it for his tests! They are very hard but he does give a review sheet. Don't be late and don't skip class. Too much info to miss a single class!

One of the best professors I've ever had. He is such a skilled lecturer and so passionate about this subject. Makes it a point to make sure everyone gets through his class and understands the material. Do yourself a favor, take his class if at all possible.
Pasasitology was an awesome class & Sugalski an epic lecturer. Tough but very fair.
He's extremely tough and merciless.

Entertaining & informative professor.  Nice guy, but don't BS him.  Easy B, just come to class, use lecture outlines, study review sheets to prepare for exam essays. Perfect attendance grade boost is pretty cool.

Okay, Doctor Sugalski is a difficult professor, but if you are looking for an easy A odds are you shouldn't be a Biology major anyway. He is challenging and rigorous BUT you LEARN the material. If you have 3 unexcused absences he drops you, but you probably would have failed the class anyway. When you leave a Sugalski class you know the material!

Tests are 70%. Lab 25%. Response papers 5%. Tests are very difficult, with the main focus being minute details. Tries to trick you with deceiving questions. Miss more than 3 classes he will fail you. Very clear in presentations. Harshly grades response papers based on grammar and content. He makes the class much more difficult than it has to be.

HUGE mistake taking this guy!! Miss 3 classes and fail! Tests are impossible due to the unbelievable detail he expects you to retain. Doesn't give out his Power Points and he gives out exam review sheets that should just say learn everything. Doesn't teach this class like a 2000 level class. Avoid this guy like the plague!
He is awesome

Sugalski is hard, but fair. Study the online quizzes and lecture notes for the tests and you'll do fine. I never particularly liked Biology, but he made it interesting for me. My only complaint is that he purposefully isn't very helpful in the labs. He will not give you a single hint toward some answers, and looks for specific answers when grading.
This guy makes everything Cystal Clear. I made a C- in high school Biology and I was able to make a B+ thanks th the clarity of the lecture's. You MUST ATTEND class though or you will fail.

Sugalski's Parasitology class completely chaged the way I look at living things.  Very interesting class & enthusiastic teacher...nice considering it was a morning lecture.  The lectures were very content heavy, so make sure you prepare for his exams!

Very good teacher. He has lecture notes that are easy to follow and he takes time to listen to your questions. Online quizzes can be annoying and tough, but they are open book. He gives out study guides that go exactly with the tests, so make sure to use them. I never used the book and I made a B, but I would have liked to have had it anyway.

Good teacher. Straight forward notes and presentations. Difficult tests at times but if enough time is taken into studying, the tests are fairly easy. Labs are a pain but also easy. Recommend this professor.

Taking his class confirms to me how bad my high school biology classes were.  His was more complicated than any I had in HS, but I had a much easier time understanding Sugalski's lectures.  Although I'd never want to major in the subject, I really liked the class.

He is a good teacher, and majority of the stuff he talks about is straight forward from the book.  The problem is about the materials.  You have to do ALOT of reading, and not just once.  Many times because this class requires alot of memorization.

Tough professor, but he provides many resources to help students (lecture notes, review sheets, online resources).  If you put in effort, this class is difficult to fail.  You will have to really know your material to get an A though! I learned a lot.  Thumbs up.

Straight forward, anal retentive, and the class is too demanding. Why have an attendance policy in an upperlevel class? Lab severely effects grades, especially the weekly lab quizzes.  No drop test and if you miss a test.. you're pretty much screwed. Better off if you take it at kennesaw..

It was odd taking a class where I often broke out into laughter listening to lecture.  Great class.  A funny guy, yet has high standards.  At the end of the semester I was amazed at how much detailed material we covered & how much I learned.  Oddly enough I never noticed at the time.  Curse his sneaky teaching methods!
